content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 2 to node 20 is:


```
2->3->9->20
```
This path is the shortest because it uses the fewest possible edges. It starts at node 2, goes to node 3, then to node 9, and finally to node 20. Note that this path is the same as the shortest path from node 2 to node 23, which is also the shortest path from node 2 to node 20.

The shortest path from node 20 to node 2 is:


```lua
20->9->2
```
This path is the shortest because it uses the fewest possible edges. It starts at node 20, goes to node 9, and finally to node 2. Note that this path is different from the shortest path from node 2 to node 23, which is not a valid path in the graph provided.
